Picture is offset after upgrade to .90 leaving space at r of screen where desktop is visible. Oddly the mouse overlay appears unaffected, to use a button or other control you must click to the right of the button. This is present in all game screens from loading to flight.

Issue remains after uninstall / reinstall

no obvious resolution issues.
If you're using the -force-opengl mode, this is a known issue. You'll need to add the -popupwindow option as well in order to get it to function properly. If not, some screenshots would help.

I will go look into that route.. I will post screen shot when I remember imgur password. Thank foryou help

I am not forcing OpenGL

I did try that and it solves the problem at the cost of making the program run unbearably slow.
Hmm. That is an unusual one, for sure. Maybe try just using the -popupwindow flag without the opengl one?

Hmm. That is an unusual one, for sure. Maybe try just using the -popupwindow flag without the opengl one?

Thanks for taking the time to try and help but sadly the issue remains.

This is what happens when you forget to disable automatic updates in steam.

Forcing open GL simply slows the machine

-popup window flag has no effect with or without open GL
Hmm. Could you upload a DxDiag and an output_log.txt file, please?

Seems like something with display driver, KSP's interpretation of screen coordinates when it starts.

Have you tried changing windows screen resolution? Try something smaller than current, even if its distorted for your display size (aspect ratio) and run KSP. Not to stay that way forever, but to force KSP to look at new numbers. if KSP fills a smaller resolution properly, then go back to normal size and see what happens.

Separately, in KSP toggle between window mode and fullscreen with [alt]-[enter] to see if that helps.

Does this happen with other games? Get two full-screen games running, and [alt]-[tab] between them.

Have played extensively with Alt+tab and Alt+enter and screen resolutions. to no avail. Likewise reloaded display drivers. Will sit down with legal pad and try a more methodical approach.

I don't haver permissions on the forum for attachments or I would post my DxDiag and an output_log.txt files. COpy and paste would be too big for the form. Any ideas on best delivery mode? Sadly I only come here when my butt is in a sling

Does KSP snap into proper screen/mouse alignment, in normal configuration, latest drivers, windowed mode? ( [Alt]+[Enter] )

You may be stuck with that for now, if performance is OK. This could be an obscure bug that goes away by itself, in a subsequent update of KSP.

I missed that you wrote "forcing OpenGL: I did try that and it solves the problem at the cost of making the program run unbearably slow."

That is very interesting, but I'm not sure where to go from there. Some graphics cards and CPU's with 3D graphics, do poorly with OpenGL.

The first thing folks would look at dxdiag logs for, is what graphics card (if any, many current CPU's perform basic 3D graphics functions) you may be using.

On DxDiag display tab: what chip type? Better still, if you can post pictures on an imaging hosting service (imgur seems very popular here) screenshots of the first two tabs (System and Display) of DxDiag would be great. [Alt]-[PrintScreen] cleanly captures the current window, to the clipboard. It can then be pasted into any image editing app, like mspaint, saved as jpg.
Uploading them to Google Drive or Dropbox is quite popular these days, if you have an account with either of those. Otherwise, text-paste sites like http://www.pastebin.com/ are probably best.
